input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Having a sister has a direct effect on blood pressure and heart condition. Blood pressure has a direct effect on heart condition. The overall probability of having a sister is 6%. The probability of not having a sister and healthy heart is 75%. The probability of having a sister and healthy heart is 1%. Is the chance of healthy heart larger when observing having a sister?
